identified-content.object.title: Advertising (Times Column)
identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Marketing, Advertising and PR

block.p: * Enson Inc., San Bruno, Calif., which plans to sell children's apparel on the Internet under the Enson brand name, to Amazon Advertising, San Francisco, to handle a national introduction. KSL Media, San Francisco, owned by True North Communications, will handle media planning and buying. Billings were estimated at $20 million to $25 million. * Dialpad.com, Santa Clara, Calif., part of Serome Technology, a free online telephone call service, to Citron Haligman Bedecarre, San Francisco, to handle its first account. Spending was estimated at $10 million to $20 million.

* Bepaid.com, New York, which compensates computer users who fill out member profiles for looking at advertising, to Stein Rogan & Partners, New York, part of the Bozell Group unit of True North Communications, to handle its first account. Spending was estimated at $15 million. * The Picture People, Foster City, Calif., part of Hallmark Cards Inc., to AKA Euro RSCG, San Francisco, part of the Euro RSCG Worldwide unit of Havas Advertising, to handle its account, which had been at Publicis Dialog, San Francisco, part of Publicis S.A. Billings were estimated at $15 million.
